Una obra maestra en toda regla

流程10小时左右，画面比较精致，但是游戏手感可以说烂透了。
如果没玩过前作，建议百度一下这个故事发生的前因后果，否则对于游戏里乱七八糟的概念和情节你会觉得相当不知所云。
总的来说这款游戏放到今天也是相当不错的作品，放到当年更是如此。
it's fun

For some reason this has always been my favorite Bioshock. I think I just prefer this aesthetic; it's much more colorful than the others. Solid FPS with a fun story. It's a shame what happened to Irrational, but at least the trilogy went out on a high note.

EDIT: Btw the game may be approaching it's 10th year since release, but the stylized graphics hold up quite well.
un juego que tiene una historia tan atrapante que te tiene pegado a la silla durante horas
Mechaniken wie die Skyhooks haben einfach sehr viel Spaß gemacht

[h1]Amé este juego [/h1]

Decidí jugar sin muchas expectativas, acabo de salir de vacaciones y no tenia mucho que hacer. Incluso ya estaba aburrido de hacer siempre lo mismo. He pasado de Minecraft a Halo, de Halo a CSGO y de CSGO a juegos como Men Of War. Nada que ver con esta tremenda joyita. Compré este juego en oferta mas que nada para "tener algo que hacer". Y ohhhh, vaya que me ha dado mucha tarea para entender esta obra de arte. Aun no he comprado los DLC pero ganas no me faltan. La historia es simplemente increíble con giros argumentales intensos (aunque con un con otro que otro hueco, pero no arruinan la experiencia).

[b] A continuación daré mi opinión con SPOILERS [/b]

Al principio, Elizabeth (La chica que tenemos que rescatar en el principio del juego) no me agradaba completamente, era muy infantil y torpe, aunque bueno, que podemos esperar de la típica princesa encerrada en la torre custodiada por un dragón. Solo que esta vez, no es una torre... Es un ángel de oro volador, y no hay ningún dragón, es un pájaro robótico mortal. La jugabilidad es simplemente increíble, y la optimización del juego es sorprendente. No tengo una PC de la NASA (GTX 1660 SUPER, 16 GB DE RAM, RYZEN 5 2600) y soy capaz de correr el juego a más de 165 hz (la taza de refresco de mi monitor)

Como va pasando la historia, poco a poco nos vamos dando cuenta que el protagonista, no solo es un hombre que busca pagar su deuda. Tiene sentimientos encontrados con Elizabeth, y no me confundan, no son sentimientos románticos, mas bien son sentimientos de padre a hija (lo cual nos da cierta perspectiva al final). Si les soy sinceros, yo no entendí el final por mi mismo. Tuve que ver un video donde lo explican mas a fondo y de ahí es donde tomé tanto cariño al juego. Terminé prácticamente enamorado por Elizabeth (no tradicionalmente, no soy un puto virgo jaja), tanto que incluso estoy pensando ordenar una figura de ella para poner en mi setup. La complejidad de este personaje me maravilló, simplemente fantástico. Pasaría este juego una y otra vez. De hecho, dejaré la reseña aqui para ir a jugarlo denuevo en lo que consigo los DLC.

[b] JUEGALO [/b]

Good companion with great backstory and character, environment and gameplay aged really well, mind-breaking plot regarding alternate universes and plot twists, it's all in one package of a game. Get it if you haven't played it yet.
güzel

[h1]"A city beneath the ocean?.... Ridiculous.”[/h1]
[u]Premise[/u]: Seemingly completely unrelated to Rapture, Infinite takes place in a city called Columbia in 1912. A city suspended in a quantum superposition. You'll play as Booker DeWitt, a man whom was once a Pinkerton. He is sent to Columbia by the Lutece Twins to recover a debt — and thus our adventure begins.

[h1][u]Mechanics[/u] and tin soldiers.[/h1]
Bioshock Infinite is the most linear of all the Bioshock games, it's a relatively strait-forward FPS. Though, I'd venture to say there are [i]less[/i] horror elements than either of its predecessors. There are few tangential jaunts you can explore such as the Vox Populi code book ciphers. But these are generally found along the way.

Infinite certainly could boast about its superior gunplay to the other games. The gunplay is vastly improved.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2441137258
Infinite uses “Vigors” instead of “Plasmids” They're essentially the same [i]superpowers[/i] using “salts” instead of “eve” to be powered. Though, lore-wise they're simply consumed through drinking them, no injections needed. Many of them are unique such as Undertow — a vigor that can grab and pull enemies closer to you while others are much more strait-forward like Devil's Kiss. Basically a grenade. However, most of the vigors can also be held and activated as traps beyond their more active ability. I particularly enjoyed “Return to Sender” which behaves as magnetic shield to catch bullets that you're able to throw back. Something analogous to Athena's shield in Pre-Sequel or the Vortex Shield in Titanfall.

Elizabeth is usually around as well. She'll toss you ammo, health or coins that she finds as you travel. She'll do this in combat as well, though she won't fight herself.

[b]Mechanical differences between Infinite and the other Bioshock games.[/b][list]
[*] Booker cannot hold more than two weapons at a time. So you can't be your own arsenal anymore.

[*] There is no hacking. However, you are able to manipulate machines with the Possession vigor or by pulling a turret or automaton through a tear.

[*] There are no more tonics. Instead you'll find gear. Standard affair sorts of hats, pants and shirts. But these will have different attributes and you'll be able to equip 4 at a time.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2441172452

[*] Weapon upgrades are purchased from vending machines rather than the one time use “Power to the People” machines.

[*] Instead of ADAM and EVE, Booker has a shield in addition to his health bar and salts. These can be upgraded by finding “infusions”.

[*] You're able to melee execute enemies with low health.[/list]

[h1]”... Because he doesn't row. — He doesn't row? — No, he [i]doesn't[/i] row. — Ah, I see what you mean.”[/h1]
The game features a semi-convoluted story line, being heavily involved with time travel and/or dimensional flipping. Seeing that this type of thing is only theoretically even possible, we have to take the game's set of rules as to how it operates. Which can be frustrating.

You will either look under here, or you will have looked under here (unless you don't want spoilers): [spoiler]The game does not feature any additional endings. There are only a few instances that have actual repercussions. While not entirely significant to the overall story, they provide a kind of subjective diegetic [i]prominence[/i]. For instance, when selecting the medallion for Elizabeth — this moment can provide an altered meaning determined by the player — the bird, symbolizing freedom and peace [of mind], is probably something you'd choose on a first playthrough, while the cage makes more sense on the second.[/spoiler]

[h1]Burial At Sea — only mechanical spoilers for the DLC here.[/h1]
I believe the DLC is necessary to feel truly satisfied with the story told in Bioshock Infinite. [b]Part 1[/b] of Burial at Sea has a some unique plasmids (yes, plasmids) but are largely the same as the main game stay for needing to scavenge a bit more as ammo and salts are slightly more rare.

[b]Part 2[/b] of Burial at Sea features another unique plasmid. This DLC is stealth-driven and the plasmid allows you to see through walls as well as make you invisible. Both parts of the DLC have upgrades available that are strewn about in the environment that will alter the plasmids. This DLC seems especially inspired by Thief: The Dark Project given the studio behind it.

[b]Clash in the Clouds[/b] is a wave-based arena mode similar to something like Killing Floor. You'll earn money, buy upgrades and prepare for battle in between waves. It's quite enjoyable, though there is no real story involved with it.

[h1]Anecdotes:[/h1]
In addition to being the [ostensible] finale to Bioshock, one of my favorite series, this game specifically holds a special place in my memory. As it was one of three games I played while in tech school for the Air Force. (The others were “I am Alive” and "Binary Domain".) I walked to the on-base library to download it as that was one of the only places with free wi-fi — took me three separate trips.

[h1]The Gist:[/h1]
While I find Rapture to be vastly more interesting as a location — Infinite tells a great story that makes sense in its own right even removed from Rapture. Columbia, while nice looking, is... kind of boring. It's got much better gunplay — though, I do find many of the vigors less interesting overall than the plasmids — largely being derivative versions from the other games.

I don't think you actually need to have played the other Bioshock games to understand this one, but you'll get a lot more out of it.

Прекрасная игра, имеющая просто потрясающий сюжет. При повторном прохождении открываешь для себя те детали, которые при первом проскальзывали. Главные герои интересны, заинтересованность повышается с каждым, я бы сказал, часом игры. Элизабет - очень хорошо прописанный персонаж, который действительно "умеет". Она не является бременем в перестрелках, а активно помогает. Тут стоит уточнить, что это не Мэри Сью. В общем, советую. 
Стрельба доставляет. Графика и левелдизайны очень хороши, в начале игры я скриншотил практически каждый уголок. Очень красиво. Игра определенно стоит своих денег.
音乐很好，没玩明白，当成使命召唤玩

This game is fantastic. Get it. Get all the Bioshocks.

- runs great on my 2008 PC which has a crap processor and only 8GB RAM with a decent GPU
- voice acting is VERY GOOD in this game 
- Combat is wicked fun, all the Vigors you get are awesome
- a lot of enemies will insult you and it's hilarious
- the AI is definitely smarter than your average FPS game
- Elizabeth is super helpful when you get in trouble she will toss you health or ammo, opens locked doors, she's awesome and cute
- the story is pretty damn good IMO
- overall, this game is quite a challenge, I actually recommend you play on keyboard/mouse because it's a lot harder to aim with a gamepad

this is definitely one of my favorite games in my library right now and I highly recommend it

Bueno juego, mal Bioshock:
Porque:
-Los enemigos en diseños son bastantes sosos  (y en gameplay no ofrecen mucho que digamos ) exceptuando tal vez los jefes, que no son malos pero no le llegan ni a los talones a los big daddys
-Atmosfera buena, pero se perdió todo el suspenso, no existe ni un solo momento de tensión
-Elizabeth es una de las mejoras compañeras, eso no lo voy a negar.
-Solo el gameplay es de Bioshock, la historia no tiene nada que ver (y que nadie me diga el final o los DLCs, que son más fan service que el carajo ...)

El juego es malo? nop, pero solo lo puedo recomendar si no te importa jugar a un fanfic bien escrito de Bioshock pero que parece que fue escrito por alquien que nunca jugo a los anteriores juegos (y si, ya se que la persona que escribió esta historia también hizo el 1, pero, exceptuando el fan service que si lo borrase del juego no afectaría en lo mas mínimo, no hay nada de las entregas anteriores.)

So I have finished the game and the next bit I submitted earlier. My final thoughts after this part.
 ** Well after about 13  hours in and still looking for motivation to finish the game. I'm finding it hard to see that this game gets such outstanding reviews. I gotta say its a very poor follow up to Bioshock 2. I really miss the  weapon wheel. Carrying 2 weapons is kinda boring and its probably the thing I would demand be changed if I was the one making decisions designing this game. Its very linear there are areas to explore off to the sides but they aren't always needed.  I'm feeling no sense of accompishment and its just not all that fun. I have just finished a huge fight with like 30 enemies in several waves. I felt no tension because I knew I was easily going to win and I always found healing and salts. I had plenty of ammo and at the end of the fight I was full health,  full vigor and still had lots of ammo.  I guess I should play on hardest but anyway I hope this helps  ** 

So most boring ending I can think of. Felt unsatisfied. All I really wanted in the last 13 hours after I wrote my first review was for the game to be over. Still felt no joy just really wanted it over so i can delete the game and never come back.  Not so with Bioshock 2 which I did twice already on Xbox but I just can't find any redeeming fun with Bioshock Infinte all in all I just hated every moment.

1.如果steam下载该游戏后点开始无法完成安装，可能是因为连的WIFI是移动网的。解决方法：换成联通或电信的，比如手机开热点（手机开移动的热点有时也行）。
2.游戏有bug，键鼠操作默认开启辅助瞄准（按机瞄时会自动锁定敌人），若想关闭需连接手柄，然后在选项中的手柄设置中关闭辅助瞄准。
3.1080p以上分辨率UI（包括字幕）会变小，可以修改“我的文档\My Games\BioShock Infinite\XGame\Config\XUI.ini”
搜索 MaxResolutionUpScale，0.0 改为 0.5 或 1.0 即可（我用的0.5）。
4.可安装跳过进入游戏时的开场动画的补丁。来源 https://dl.3dmgame.com/patch/30100.html
5.汉化补丁分两种：
①简体中文补丁 0.3：直接将官方繁体中文转化成简体，DLC部分内容仍为繁体。由于官方繁中质量不行所以不建议使用。来源(修改UI的方法也是从这来的) https://keylol.com/t275352-1-1
②生化奇兵 無限 - 個人繁體中文化 20.3.4：仍为繁中，但修正了一些官方繁中翻译的错误，建议使用。来源 https://keylol.com/forum.php?mod=viewthread&tid=497035&highlight=%E7%94%9F%E5%8C%96%E5%A5%87%E5%85%B5

ps：目测3DM等网站的简中补丁并没有翻译后续DLC（比如14年的海葬第二章），所以不用考虑。

the story is good but it just slugs so much and it's told in these small increments. You have to get through a good chunk of shooting until you can recieve another piece of the story.

The gameplay gets honestly eventually boring. Yes you can use different powers and weapons but it has little power on ejoyablitity of the gameplay when the game is so long. [i](I played the game 2 times in the last few years but I always quit somewhere halfway because I lost interest and got bored)[/i]

The game has reeaally good graphics especially for a 2013 game. It's beautiful to look at most times so that somewhat boost the gameplay.

The finall "boss fight" was an unexpected disappointment.
the final boss fight is basically a defense section back from PS1/PS2 days and it's really not epic. On hard difficulty it was only EXTREMELY hard and annoying compared to the rest of the game. Really really unnecessary "boss fight"

It's still an overall ok to good game that the majority of people will really like.
I myself cannot recommend this though and I wish to never have to play it again in it's entirety.

the story to me felt like the most compelling part of the game, as it should be for a plot driven game. however as good as the plot is it can only keep someone interested for so long. this is where the combat takes place. this is also done well because the mixture of weapons and vigors was handled well. i had no problem switching between relying on my gun or vigors depending on the situation. lastly i was a bit apprehensive at the start of the game when i first got my vigors because the abilities in this game have to be replenished by certain consumable objects, but as the game progressed i found plenty of things to replenish it and this feeling subsided. before i knew it i was slinging bullets and crows like a true zealot of the lady
